Subject: Character Problems - What's an Author to Do?
Description: A main character needs to start out annoying, boring, or unappealing. (they have to grow from somewhere!) Your readers say 'ugh' and set your book aside. What's an author to do? How do we avoid this? Examples?  Speakers include:Mary Lynne Gibbs, Paul Kemner, Emmy Jackson, Cindy Spencer Pape, Jeff Pryor - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Writing Fast and Slow
Description: Are you a hack if you write quickly? Are you an amateur if you write slowly? How many books a year should a working writer produce, and how has that expectation changed in todays publishing climate? How quickly do readers want or expect the next book?  Speakers include:Alex Kourvo, Jen Haeger, Jim Leach, Catherynne Valente, Jeff Pryor - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Erotica in Speculative Fiction
Description: Birds do it, bees do it, and elves and aliens do it. Our panelists talk about erotica in science fiction and fantasy genre fiction.  Speakers include:Ken MacGregor, Jay Maynard, Dave Klecha, Jeff Pryor - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
